About Me

I am an undergraduate senior at Columbia University, studying Computer Science.

News

  • October 2017 Gave a talk at DSLDI 2017 in Vancouver Canada

Research

I am interested in computer graphics, computer vision, and programming languages. As a visual learner who happens to like designing and implementing programming languages, I aspire to create new languages for graphics/vision applications. Currently, I am working on Penrose, a system that visualizes mathematics from high-level, declarative programs.

Education

B.S. in Computer Science, Dickinson College
B.S. in Computer Science, Columbia University

Personal

My name is 倪沃德 ( ní wò dé ) in Chinese. “Nimo” has been my alias since high school, during which I was a street dancer (Popping) and competed under this alias. My first name, often written as “Wode”, looks like a single word and people often pronounce it that way. Sadly, I have trouble answering to “ Wode “ in all environments. If you find it hard to pronounce ( ní wò dé ) , try “Nimo”.

I have been playing Yo-yo since elementary school, and won provincial contests. I mostly do 1A. Broadly speaking, I am interested in many forms of Object manipulation, such as Zippo tricks and pen spinning.

I love billiards, especially Snooker.
